question: Sun will appear at same latitude:

choices.choice: Once a year
Twice a year
Once a day

explanation: Because the sun moves across the sky throughout the day, it will also pass through the same latitude again later in the day, resulting in another instance where the sun appears at the same latitude.
subject: Navigation

question: The angle between the plane of the ecliptic and the plane of equator is approximately:
subject: Navigation

question: In its path around the Sun, the axis of the Earth has an inclination:

choices.choice: of 66°33' with the plane of the path.
varying between zero and 23° 27 with the plane of the pat
varying with the season of the year.

subject: Navigation

question: The times given for sunrise, sunset, morning and evening twilight in the air almanac:

choices.choice: are given in UTC.
are given in standard time.
are given in LMT.

subject: Navigation

question: The term Aphelion is used to describe:

choices.choice: The relative position between the earth and the moon.
The situation when the distance between the sun and the earth is at its longest.
The relationship between the length of the day and the length of the night.

subject: Navigation

question: What is the highest latitude listed below at which the sun will reach an altitude of 90° above the horizon at some time during the year?
subject: Navigation

question: The duration of civil twilight is the time:

choices.choice: needed by the sun to move from the apparent height of 0° to the apparent height of 6°
between sunset and when the centre of the sun is 12° below the true horizon
between sunset and when the centre of the sun is 6° below the true horizon

subject: Navigation

question: At what approximate date is the earth closest to the sun (perihelion)?

choices.choice: End of June
Beginning of July
Beginning of January

subject: Navigation

question: When the length of the day is measured with reference to the passage of the apparent sun:

choices.choice: The length of the day will be the same once every month.
The length of the day will vary with the latitude of the observer.
The length of the day will wary in the course of the year.

subject: Navigation

question: The direction of the Earths rotation on its axis is such that:

choices.choice: Observed from the point above the North Pole, the rotation is counter-clockwise.
Any point on the surface of the Earth will move eastward.
Any point on the surface of the Earth will move westward.

explanation: The Earth rotates on its axis in a counterclockwise direction when viewed from above the North Pole, which means it rotates from west to east.
subject: Navigation

choices.choice: Earth's elliptical orbit around the Sun
inclination of the polar axis with the ecliptic plane
Earth's rotation on its polar axis

question: At what approximate date is the earth furthest from the sun (aphelion)?

choices.choice: Beginning of January
End of December
Beginning of July

subject: Navigation

choices.choice: Is only of interest to users of astronomical navigation.
Moves with constant speed along the celestial equator.
Is the middle position of the sun.

question: All heavenly bodies rise

choices.choice: In the East.
In the West.
Some in the East and some in the West depending upon the hemisphere.

explanation: All heavenly bodies appear to rise in the east and set in the west as observed from Earth. This is due to Earth's rotation on its axis from west to east.
subject: Navigation

choices.choice: cause the sunrise to occur earlier and the sunset to occur later.
causes the sunrise and the sunset to occur earlier.
causes the sunrise to occur later and the sunset to occur earlier.
sun altitude is 18° below the celestial horizon
sun altitude is 12° below the celestial horizon
sun altitude is 6° below the celestial horizon

question: Which is the highest latitude listed below at which the sun will rise above the horizon and set every day?
subject: Navigation

question: The main reason that day and night, throughout the year, have different duration, is due to the?

choices.choice: Relative speed of the sun along the ecliptic.
Inclination of the ecliptic to the equator.
Earth's rotation.

subject: Navigation
